image.altText: Bart Butson looks at the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Commercial fishers in the Gulf St Vincent tell a Senate inquiry it would be best to close the area in order to save the future of the catch and the industry.

title.children: Calls for SA gulfs to be shut to protect 'near-non-existent' stocks amid algal bloom

image.altText: A SA Police officer's shoulder badge.

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old is arrested and charged after another teen is found with serious stab wounds to his chest in South Australia.

title.children: Teen suffers life-threatening injuries in Port Lincoln stabbing

image.altText: A close-up of a cat's mouth and whiskers.

props.synopsis: A regional South Australian council has publicly apologised to a family whose lost pet was euthanased after it was mistaken for a feral cat.

title.children: 'Beloved' pet euthanased after being mistaken for feral cat

image.altText: A trench containing the bodies of pigs and plastic waste.

props.synopsis: Footage taken at four South Australian piggeries shows animals confined in sow stalls and evidence of potential cannibalism.

title.children: Mass grave filmed at SA piggery tied to animal welfare investigation

image.altText: Man in grey hoodie and grey beanie holds box of groceries

props.synopsis: A year after opening its doors, OzHarvest's first free supermarket in Adelaide says demand for food relief is greater than ever.

title.children: OzHarvest says more people seeking food relief amid cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: Woman stands straightening younger woman's hair who sits in chair infront of mirror.

props.synopsis: The "salon" is an op shop and the round-trip commute's a doozy, but Juliann Mutch is happy to go the extra distance to pamper her grateful Wilcannia clientele.

title.children: Outback hairdresser drives 1,000km just to 'spoil' her clients

image.altText: Josh Rachele holds his arms out and yells in celebration

props.synopsis: The Crows have received a major boost ahead of their knockout semifinal against the Hawks, with livewire forward Josh Rachele recalled after a knee injury.

title.children: Crows livewire returns from injury for knockout semi against Hawks

image.altText: Courtroom sketch of a man with a bald head and a beard looking sad

props.synopsis: The trial against a South Australian man accused of murder has been vacated after a jury member allegedly googled information, a court has heard.

title.children: Mistrial declared in alleged murder case after juror googled information, court hears

image.altText: A bald man, smiling, in a chequered shirt.

props.synopsis: A small community on South Australia's Lower Eyre Peninsula pays tribute to Jarred Wait, who died in an agricultural plane crash at Cummins.

title.children: Community mourns young father after fatal Eyre Peninsula plane crash

image.altText: Aerial view of the bubble curtain showing an area of ocean with a white bubble ring

props.synopsis: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

title.children: 'Bubble curtain' ready for use as SA's algal bloom persists

image.altText: Britain's King Charles III with SA Premier Peter Malinauskas.

props.synopsis: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas meets with the sovereign on an official visit to the United Kingdom, during which he also signs an agreement with nuclear reactor manufacturer Rolls-Royce regarding the AUKUS submarine agreement.

title.children: King Charles hosts SA premier, who 'would love' royal visit at climate summit

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: A driver will face court charged over the deaths of two men in a ute rollover on KI on Wednesday night. In a separate incident in SA's far north, a pedestrian suffered life-threatening injuries when she was hit by a bus on the Stuart Highway.

title.children: Driver charged after two men killed in Kangaroo Island ute rollover

image.altText: Seven women, including Nisha Khot, wear sarees, stand in front of film posters, saying now showing in a cinema hall.

props.synopsis: Nearly two weeks after the "March for Australia" rallies, the Indian Australian community continues to grapple with the political targeting of the diaspora.

title.children: Indian Australians urge Jacinta Nampijinpa Price to apologise to help community 'heal'

image.altText: A slow shutter speed blurs the movement of two horses training at a racetrack.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian racing integrity investigation finds a number of racing stewards, including the acting chief thoroughbred steward, placed more than 200 bets on races across a two-and-a-half-year period.

title.children: Stewards placed hundreds of bets on Tasmanian races, investigation finds

image.altText: Two men in suits, one carrying a large red bag, walking out of Brisbane Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: Mr Palmer is facing two counts of fraud and dishonestly using his position as a company director to funnel millions into his party's 2013 election campaign, and in a separate matter, his company is charged with breaching company takeover laws in 2012.

title.children: Clive Palmer's human rights complaint referred to Supreme Court

image.altText: Daniel Ek, co-founder and CEO of music streaming service Spotify on stage gesturing with the Spotify logo and signage behind him

props.synopsis: A growing number of artists and users are leaving Spotify. What's changed with the streaming giant? And what comes next?

title.children: Why are musicians and listeners boycotting Spotify?

image.altText: Aerial shot of Rockingham beach, houses, garden island and the causeway to the island.

props.synopsis: The head of Australia's submarine agency says planning is so far advanced to settle the American soldiers that quarantine arrangements for their pets are underway.

title.children: Inside the plan to station 1,200 Americans and their subs near Perth

image.altText: An aerial picture of a lagoon inside a narrow atoll.

props.synopsis: China says its newly announced reserve is about preserving coral, but the Philippines says it is another step towards Bejing tightening its claim on a contested, strategic area of the South China Sea.

title.children: China announces new nature reserve in middle of contested, strategic waters

image.altText: Mohammed bin Albdulrahman bin Jassim Al-Thani sitting at a UN Security Council desk with a Qatar tag in front of colleagues

props.synopsis: The Qatari prime minister tells the United Nations Security Council that Israel went "beyond any borders" with the strike and says Benjamin Netanyahu is to blame for killing "any hope for those hostages".

title.children: Qatar accuses Israel of ignoring Gaza hostages in attack on Doha

image.altText: An Aldi shopping cart

props.synopsis: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

title.children: More Australian consumers are falling for mimic shopping websites

image.altText: Jayne Hrdlicka_Brisbane Airport.jpg

props.synopsis: The ASX rises, as do Virgin shares, as the airline reveals the exit pay of its former CEO. Mixed data out of the US economy sees expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut next week solidify. Follow the day's events and insights on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Virgin reveals $50 million payday for ex-boss Jayne Hrdlicka

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'Chaos in just about every sector' says US-based economics professor Justin Wolfers
Woodside gets final federal approval for North West Shelf extension
Iron ore on track for third weekly gain

image.altText: Australian golfing great Greg Norman waves at the crowd from a stage next to a trophy on a lectern saying "LIV GOLF".

props.synopsis: Australian golfing great Greg Norman officially calls time on his controversial spell as a key figure in the LIV Golf tour revolution.

title.children: 'We ... changed the world': Norman expresses pride as he ends controversial LIV Golf stint

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch and Kendall Roy, who wears headphones and sunglasses, on a blue and green gradient background

props.synopsis: As Lachlan Murdoch's ascension to the head of the family business is cemented, can you tell his quotes apart from Succession's self-proclaimed "eldest boy", Kendall Roy?

title.children: Who said it: Lachlan Murdoch or Succession's Kendall Roy?

image.altText: Yuna sits down on the floor while Minu holds a mickey mouse toy.

props.synopsis: Hakyung Lee is accused of murdering her children, eight-year-old Yuna Jo and six-year-old Minu Jo, and leaving their remains in suitcases at a storage facility in Auckland.

title.children: Murdered children's PlayStation data allegedly the last proof they were alive

image.altText: Matt Kean, Chris Bowen, Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: A growing cross-factional group within Labor is privately urging for Australia's next major climate target to respect the advice of the Climate Change Authority, which will hand its opinion on a 2035 target to government any day.

title.children: Growing group of Labor MPs urge 2035 emissions target above Climate Authority's floor

image.altText: An elderly man sips on a drink with a straw in front of more than a dozen cupcakes.

props.synopsis: States and territories will use a health ministers' meeting today to call on the federal government to do more to address what they say is a critical aged care crisis affecting hospitals around the nation.

title.children: 'A tragedy': 2,500 elderly patients stuck in hospital waiting for aged care

image.altText: Four Diamonds players stand in line and clap and smile

props.synopsis: Netball Australia and the players' association strike a landmark revenue-sharing deal as part of a three-year collective player agreement.

title.children: Netball players to get share of Diamonds' revenue in landmark deal

image.altText: Crowd in stand, dogs blurry

props.synopsis: One of the most famed tracks in Australian greyhound racing, known as the Dapto Dogs, has held its final race meet after almost 90 years.

title.children: Dogs cross line for last time at famed track after 90 years of racing

image.altText: A close-up of Emmanuel Macron frowning.

props.synopsis: France is stuck in a cycle of political chaos, with no clear end in sight. It has sparked calls for President Emmanuel Macron's resignation and has become so dire that another round of snap legislative elections is considered possible.

title.children: Macron is so unpopular in France, many say resignation is his only option

image.altText: Peter Mandelson and Keir Starmer walking down a hallway smiling

props.synopsis: After dogging the US president for months, evidence of a connection to Jeffrey Epstein has claimed a senior scalp within the British government.

title.children: How the Jeffrey Epstein saga spread to British politics

image.altText: A police car with its lights on.

props.synopsis: Police allege two men fatally shot a man in Melbourne two days after shooting another dead.

title.children: Two men charged with murder allegedly involved in second fatal shooting

image.altText: Two men in suits outside court.

props.synopsis: James Fitzgerald and Alexander Papanastassis are charged with negligent manslaughter over the death of Luke Briggs, who died eight days after his arrest last year.

title.children: Police officers face court over death of Luke Briggs

image.altText: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro addresses rally

props.synopsis: The former Brazilian president, Jair Bolsonaro, has been sentenced to 27 years in prison at the age of 70 and may spend the rest of his life behind bars.

title.children: Ex-Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro found guilty of coup charges

image.altText: Wallaroos forward Ashley Fernandez catches the ball in a line out during a women's rugby test against Wales.

props.synopsis: Australia's Wallaroos are dreaming of an unlikely World Cup semifinal berth, but they will need to get past a team they have never beaten before.

title.children: Wallaroos targeting World Cup quarterfinal boilover

image.altText: Koren Helbig adds food scraps to a plastic compost bin

props.synopsis: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

title.children: An easy, stress-free way to manage and aerate your compost
